intro: Agave vivipara var. rubescens, commonly known as the red agave, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern and thick, fleshy leaves that range in color from blue-green to reddish hues. The plant produces striking inflorescences of yellow flowers, which appear at the center of the rosette after several years. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. The variety rubescens is distinguished by its vibrant red stems and leaves, which add a dramatic visual contrast to its environment.
